document.docTitle: Xiphovelia denigrata Ye & Bu, 2015, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Xiphovelia Lundblad, 1933 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Veliidae) from China, with descriptions of three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the genus Xiphovelia Lundblad, 1933 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Veliidae) from China, with descriptions of three new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Holotype : apterous male, CHINA , Zhejiang Prov. , Lishui city, Suichang county, Jiulongshan Nature Reserve (
28 ° 23 ' N
,
118 ° 50 ' E
), alt. 409 m ,
04.VIII. 2011
, coll. Zhen Ye. Paratypes : CHINA , Zhejiang Prov. , 3 apterous males, 5 apterous females and 1 macropterous male, same data as for holotype .

X. glauca Esaki & Miyamoto, 1959
(1. apterous male; 2. apterous female); 3– 4.

sp. nov. (3. apterous male; 4. apterous female). Scale 1.0 mm.

sp. nov.
(8. apterous male; 9. macropterous male; 10. macropterous female). Scale 1.0 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The specific name is derived from the Latin denigratus means blackish, refers to the colour of legs almost black.
